subject: Investing
title: The VIX: Fear Index
description: A 60-second lesson on The VIX: Fear Index.

hook.text: In March 2020 the VIX hit 82â€”higher than the 2008 crisis. Markets were pricing in pure terror.

buildup.text: The VIX measures expected S&P 500 volatility over the next 30 days, derived from option prices.

discovery.text: A VIX below 15 signals calm. Above 30 means fear. Above 50 means panic selling is underway.

twist.text: Historically, buying stocks when the VIX spikes above 30 has produced above-average forward returns.

climax.text: The VIX can't predict crashes, but it can tell you how scared the market is right now.

punchline.text: The VIX reads the market's mood. Use it for context, not prophecy.
